api_list.name: DisableBeneficiary
api_list.description: Disable an existing beneficiary record by VendorID. Once a beneficiary is disabled, it can only be re-enabled by contacting AFEX. Can be used for a standard beneficiary or an instant beneficiary.

api_list.name: CreatePayment
api_list.description:
Create scheduled payment.  A scheduled payment may be made to a standard beneficiary or an instant beneficiary (instant beneficiaries allow one AFEX client to send funds to another AFEX client - see Create Instant Payment Beneficiary for more information).  Note, instant payments do not attract wire fees as they are processed entirely within AFEX's system.  

**Request Parameters**
------------

|Parameter	|Description	|Required	|
|-----------|-----------|-----------|
|Amount|Amount of the payment.|**True**|
|Currency|3 letter ISO currency code which is available via [api/Currency](https://doc.api.afex.com/?version=latest#ed9f7e96-8fad-4152-8b62-fe8ce91c0310).|**True**|
|PaymentDate|YYYY/MM/DD. Date the payment will be processed and sent by AFEX to the beneficiary. The soonest available PaymentDate can be determined using [api/ValueDates](https://doc.api.afex.com/?version=latest#f8a2ef3b-0ed0-478f-9a03-9cf5337c9177)  . For an AFEX instant beneficiary, the payment date can be any date including non working days, weekends and bank holidays.|**True**|
|PopCode|AFEX standard Purpose of Payment code as returned by [api/PurposeOfPayment](https://doc.api.afex.com/?version=latest#90aa9a5a-fd0a-495f-87ae-013df076d327). This will populate remittance line 2 of the wire transfer.|False|
|ReferenceNumber|AFEX ReferenceNumber (transaction ID) for payment already booked. If populated, the request will be treated as an update to the existing scheduled payment providing it has not already been processed.|False|
|VendorId|Identifier for the beneficiary the payment is to be sent to.  *Note that both Currency of the Payment and the VendorId must be the same in order to create the payment*.|**True**|

api_list.name: CreatePredeliveryOnOutrightForward
api_list.description:
Create a predelivery (drawdown) on an outright forward.

**Request Parameters**
------------

|Parameter	|Description	|Required	|
|-----------|-----------|-----------|
|AccountNumber|AFEX client's direct debit bank account number. Only required if the trade is to be settled via direct debit. The account number must match the direct debit account number held on file for the client.|False|
|Amount|Amount of the currency to be pre-delivered from the remaining balance on the parent forward.|**True**|
|Note|Alphanumberic string. 250 char. @“^([a-zA-Z0-9/-?:().,+\x20}){1,250}$” Free text entered by the user for their own reference.|False|
|POPCode|AFEX standard Purpose of Payment code as returned by the method [api/PurposeOfPayment](https://doc.api.afex.com/?version=latest#90aa9a5a-fd0a-495f-87ae-013df076d327).  This will populate remittance line 2 of the wire transfer.|False|
|PurposeOfPayment| Alphanumberic string. 35 char. No special characters. Free text purpose of payment e.g. invoice number, contact name of sender etc. Will be sent in remittance line 4 of the wire transfer.|False|
|ValueDate|YYYY/MM/DD. The date the trade currency funds will be paid out.   For a predelivery, the value date cannot be greater than 14 days from the date of creation of the predelivery (inclusive of weekends and public holidays).|**True**|
|VendorId|Identifier for the beneficiary the trade funds are to be paid out to. If a vendor ID is not provided, the trade proceeds are credited to the client's AFEX funding balance.|**True**|
|ParentTradeNumber|AFEX TradeNumber (AFEX transaction ID) of parent trade.|**True**|
|QuoteId|Quote ID from api/predelivery/quote if a quote is used to lock in the rate for the pre-delivery trade (providing the quote has not expired).|False|

api_list.name: CreateBeneficiary
api_list.description:
Create a new beneficiary.  Funds can be sent to a beneficiary bank account by specifying the beneficiary's VendorID in an api/payments/create request.

When creating a beneficiary, you may assign your own unique VendorID in the create request, or otherwise the AFEX system will assign a default VendorID. 

The required data for a beneficiary varies based on currency, clearing method (SWIFT/high value or local clearing/low value), beneficiary entity type (corporate or individual), and beneficiary and bank country.  This validation utilizes AFEX payment and currency rules to derive the details needed to deliver a payment to a beneficiary.  When all the required data is submitted, the beneficiary will be created with a status of "Approved" or "Pending".  Where the status is "Pending", this will require manual review and approval by AFEX.

Note that an iterative approach is recommended for the beneficiary creation (As seen in the below steps 1 - 4.)  *A detailed design document outlining this flow is available upon request from your Implementation Program Manager.*

    1. Submit the minimum set of beneficiary data as described as described above i.e. currency, HighLowValue, Corporate=true or false, bank country code and beneficiary address and country code
    2. Review the remaining required data as indicated by the response
    3. Submit required beneficiary data
    4. Repeat until the response indicates "Beneficiary has been created", Status "Approved" or "Pending"


**Request Parameters**
------------

|Parameter	|Description	|Required	|
|-----------|-----------|-----------|
|BankAccountNumber|Beneficiary account number|**True**|
|BankAddress1|Beneficiary bank address line 1|**True**|
|BankAddress2|Beneficiary bank address line 2|Varies by currency|
|BankAddress3|Beneficiary bank address line 3|False|
|BankCountryCode|Beneficiary bank country code|**True**|
|BankName|Beneficiary bank name|True (auto-populated with BankSWIFTBIC or BankRoutingCOde|
|BankRoutingCode|Beneficiary bank routing/sort code|Varies by currency|
|BankSWIFTBIC|Beneficiary bank SWIFTBIC|Varies by currency|
|BeneficiaryAddressLine1|Beneficiary address line 1|Varies by currency|
|BeneficiaryAddressLine2|Beneficiary address line 2|Varies by currency|
|BeneficiaryCity|Beneficiary city|**True**|
|BeneficiaryCountryCode|Beneficiary country code|**True**|
|BeneficiaryName|Beneficiary name|**True**|
|BeneficiaryPostalCode|Beneficiary post code|**True**|
|BeneficiaryRegion|Beneficiary region|Varies by currency|
|Corporate|Corporate account = True/False|False: *defaults to Corporate*|
|Currency|Beneficiary currency must = currency of bank account|**True**|
|HighLowValue|Low (local clearing) = 0, High (wire) = 1|False - *defaults to 1*|
|IntermediaryBankAccountNumber|Auto-puplated using beneficiary bank data|False|
|IntermediaryBankAddress1|Auto-puplated using beneficiary bank data|False|
|IntermediaryBankAddress2|Auto-puplated using beneficiary bank data|False|
|IntermediaryBankAddress3|Auto-puplated using beneficiary bank data|False|
|IntermediaryBankCountryCode|Auto-puplated using beneficiary bank data|False|
|IntermediaryBankName|Auto-puplated using beneficiary bank data|False|
|IntermediaryBankRoutingCode|Auto-puplated using beneficiary bank data|False|
|IntermediaryBankSWIFTBIC|Auto-puplated using beneficiary bank data|False|
|NotificationEmail|Beneficiary email adress for payment notification email|False|
|RemittanceLine1|Auto-populated with 'by order of' information|False|
|RemittanceLine2|Purpose of payment code via [api/PurposeOfPayment](https://afexapi.postman.co/collections/1995236-4bea80e5-985b-49d4-8b50-6a716fd31518?version=latest&workspace=73d1bfae-8346-4565-8044-fabbb7918b74#426e3783-e672-4b64-a132-8966c760ebb6)|Varies by currency|
|RemittanceLine3|Special remittance data for some exotic currencies|Varies by currency|
|RemittanceLine4|Special remittance data for some exotic currencies|Varies by currency|
|VendorId|Unique ID for beneficiary record|**True**|
